paramInformation.label: Basic Set Level
paramInformation.description: Setting the basic command value to turn on the light. the 0xff(-1) means turn on the light. for dimmer equipment 1 to 100 means the light strength.0 means turn off the light.caution: the value is unsigned byte, the range is from 0x00 ~ 0xff

options.label: Equipment 1 to 100 means the light strength. 0 means turn off the light
Turn off the light

paramInformation.label: Pir Sensitivity
paramInformation.description: Pir sensitivity settings.0 means disable the PIR motion.1 means the lowest sensitivity,99 means the highest sensitivity.high sensitivity means can detected long distance, but if there is more noise signal in the environment, it will re-trigger too frequency

options.label: Disable the PIR motion
The lowest sensitivity
The highest sensitivity

paramInformation.label: Light Threshold
paramInformation.description: The light will only turn on when the environment illumination is below this setting. 1: darkest; 99: brightest

options.label: Disable illumination check

paramInformation.label: Operation Mode
paramInformation.description: Operation mode. using bit to control.caution: the value is unsigned byte, the range is from 0x00 ~ 0xff. bit0: reserve. bit1: 1 means test mode,   0 means normal mode. bit2: disable the door/window  function. (1:disable, 0:enable) bit3: setting the temperature scale.  0: fahrenheit, 1:celsius bit4: disable the illumination report  after event triggered. (1:disable, 0:enable) bit5: disable the temperature report  after event triggered. (1:disable, 0:enable) bit6: reserve. bit7: disable the back key release into test mode.  (1:disable, 0:enable)

options.label: Setting operation mode
Bit0: reserve
Bit1: 1 means test mode, 0 means normal mode
Bit2: disable the door/window function.(1:disable, 0:enable)
Bit3: setting the temperature scale. 0: fahrenheit, 1:celsius
Bit4: disable the illumination report after event triggered. (1:disable, 0:enable)
Bit5: disable the temperature report after event triggered. (1:disable, 0:enable)
Bit6: reserve
Bit7: disable the back key release into test mode. (1:disable, 0:enable)

paramInformation.label: Mult- Sensor Function Switch
paramInformation.description: Multisensor function switch. using bit to control.caution: the value is unsigned byte, the range is from 0x00 ~ 0xff.  bit0: disable magnetic integrate  illumination to turn on the lighting  nodes in the association group 2.  (1:disable, 0:enable) bit1: disable PIR integrate  illumination to turn on the lighting  nodes in the association group 2.  (1:disable, 0:enable) bit2: disable magnetic integrate PIR  to turn on the lighting nodes in the  association group 2. (1:disable,  0:enable) (default is disable) bit3: when bit2 is 0 (enable), are the  device and the lighting in the same  room? 0: in the same room(default),1: in the different room. bit4: disable delay 5 seconds to turn off the light, when door/window closed. (1:disable, 0:enable) bit5: disable auto turn off the light, after door/window opened to turn on the light. (1:disable, 0:enable) bit6: reserve. bit7: reserve

options.label: Multisensor function switch
Bit0: disable magnetic integrate illumination to turn on the lighting nodes in the association group 2. (1:disable, 0:enable)
Bit1: disable PIR integrate illumination to turn on the lighting nodes in the association group 2. (1:disable, 0:enable)
Bit2: disable magnetic integrate pir
Bit3: when bit2 is 0 (enable), are the device and the lighting in the same room? 0: in the same room(default),1: in the different room
Bit4: disable delay 5 seconds to turn off the light, when door/window closed.(1:disable, 0:enable)
Bit5: disable auto turn off the light, after door/window opened to turn on the light.(1:disable, 0:enable)
Bit6: reserve
Bit7: reserve

paramInformation.label: Customer Function
paramInformation.description: Customer function switch, using bit control.caution: the value is unsigned byte, the range is from 0x00 ~ 0xff.  bit0: reserve. bit1: enable sending motion off report. (0:disable, 1:enable) bit2: enable PIR super sensitivity mode. (0:disable, 1:enable) bit3: disable send out basic off after door closed. (1:disable, 0:enable) bit4: notification type,  0: using notification report.  1: using sensor binary report. bit5: disable multi cc in auto report. (1:disable, 0:enable) bit6: disable to report battery state when the device triggered.(1:disable, 0:enable) bit7: reserve

options.label: Customer function switch
Bit0: reserve
Bit1: enable sending motion off report. (0:disable, 1:enable)
Bit2: enable PIR super sensitivity mode. (0:disable, 1:enable)
Bit3: disable send out basic off after door closed. (1:disable,0:enable)
Bit4: notification type, 0: using notification report. 1: using sensor binary report
Bit5: disable multi cc in auto report. (1:disable, 0:enable)
Bit6: disable to report battery state when the device triggered.(1:disable, 0:enable)
Bit7: reserve

paramInformation.label: Auto Report Battery Time
paramInformation.description: The default value is 12. the tick time can setting by the configuration no.20

paramInformation.label: Auto Report Door/Window State
paramInformation.description: The default value is 12. the tick time can setting by the configuration no.20

paramInformation.label: Auto Report Illumination Time
paramInformation.description: The default value is 12. the tick time can setting by the configuration no.20

paramInformation.label: Auto Report Temperature Time
paramInformation.description: The default value is 12. the tick time can setting by the configuration no.20

paramInformation.label: Auto Report Tick Interval
paramInformation.description: The unit is 1 minute,setting this configuration will effect configuration no.10, no.11, no.12 and no.13

paramInformation.label: Temperature Differential Report
paramInformation.description: Enable this function the device will detect every minutes. and when the temperature is over 140 degree fahrenheit, it will continue report

paramInformation.label: Illumination Differential Report
paramInformation.description: Enable this function the device will detect every minutes

metadata.inclusion:
There are two tamper keys in the device, one is in the back side, another is in the front side. Both of them can add, remove, reset or association from Z-Wave network.
To add into a Z-Wave network: 
1. Have Z-Wave Controller entered inclusion mode.
2. Pressing tamper key three times within 1.5 seconds to enter the inclusion mode.
3. After add successful, the device will wake to receive the setting command from Z-Wave Controller about 20 seconds
metadata.exclusion:
There are two tamper keys in the device, one is in the back side, another is in the front side. Both of them can add, remove, reset or association from Z-Wave network.
To remove the device from a Z-Wave network: 
1. Have Z-Wave Controller entered exclusion mode.
2. Pressing tamper key three times within 1.5 seconds to enter the exclusion mode.
Node ID has been excluded
metadata.reset:
There are two tamper keys in the device, one is in the back side, another is in the front side. Both of them can add, remove, reset or association from Z-Wave network.
To reset the device: 
Notice: Use this procedure only in the event that the primary controller is lost or otherwise inoperable.
1. Pressing tamper key four times within 1.5 seconds and do not release the tamper key in the 4th pressed, and the LED will light ON.
2. After 3 seconds the LED will turn OFF, after that within 2 seconds, release the tamper key. If successful, the LED will light ON one second. Otherwise, the LED will flash once.
3. IDs are excluded and all settings will reset to factory default
